newsitem.title: USA: Scriptel in deal with creditor.
newsitem.headline: Scriptel in deal with creditor.

text.p: Scriptel Holding Inc said Monday a big creditor converted Scriptel debt into stock.
Scriptel also announced it cut its interest in its Coloray unit. Scriptel makes cordless pens for computer makers.

A Scriptel statement said creditor Walter T. Krumm converted his interest in the $772,399 debt Scriptel owes him to 7.7 million shares of common stock. Krumm also agreed to cancel warrants for 5.7 million shares at $0.40-$0.75 a share and replace them with warrants for $0.14 a share.

Krumm agreed to relinquish 1.8 million warrants to provide the company with sufficient shares for private offerings last year. The new warrants, exercisable until December 31, 2001, may be terminated if the price exceeds $1.00, it said. The stock closed up four cents a share at $0.21 on the Nasdaq.

Scriptel added that, on December 31, as part of a consulting agreement with former Coloray president M. Kathy Vieth, Scriptel transferred to Vieth 50,000 Coloray shares, reducing its holdings to 46 percent and ending its consolidated subsidiary status. As a result, Scriptel expects to report about $3.5 million in lower liabilities than it would have. Under the consulting agreement, Vieth is to promote and license Coloray technology, Scriptel said.
